dashboard.label: Setup Instructions
dashboard.description: Setup Instructions for retrieving AppDynamics data into Splunk

tr.td:
The AppDynamics Summary data input gather metrics in the following categories for applications in AppDynamics:
Overall Application Performance
End User Experience
Applicatin Events
Health Rule Violations
Business Transaction Performance
Infrastructure Performance
To create a Summary input add your AppDynamics collector's host, you will need the following:
AppDynamics Collector's IP Address and Port
Authentication token
(Optional) Application Name
Note 1: If you leave the 'Application Name' field blank ALL applications will be retrived. If you want selected applications, simply enter the application name or a comma-separated list of application names.
Note 2: For larger environments, keep in mind that for each application there will be up to 6 REST API calls made to AppDynamics depending on your metric set selections. Be sure to allow for this when you specify how frequently to collect the data.
For example, if you have 50 applications and choose all 6 metric sets, that will result in 300 REST API calls to the AppDynamics controller. If you're collecting the data every 5 minutes (300 seconds), that would be 1 call per second sustained and could have adverse impacts on the AppDynamics Controller. For larger environments, please supply a comma-sparated list of Applications you would like to collect data for in Splunk.
Create a new data input by Opening the Splunk Add-on for AppDynamics app. From there, click the Create New Input button and select "AppDynamics Summary":
Enter the settings below and save.
Now visit the Overview page and see your AppDynamics data!
Or you can now start searching using sourcetype="appdynamics_summary"

In some cases there may be additional metrics you would like to gather from AppDynamics or metrics at different levels such as an individual set of metrics for a given "Tier" in AppDynamics. In this case you can use the AppDynamics Single API Call data input to collect precisely the data you want. Use the Settings --> Data Inputs --> AppDynamics Single API Call input for this.
These are the options you will need to supply for each input:
Host and Port of you AppDynamics Controller
Authorization Token
Time Duration to collect
Minutes you would like to collect data for (prior to NOW). -- i.e. 5 = collect data for the past 5 minutes
Applicaiton Name or ID
The AppDynamics REST API requires a specific application for which to retrieve metrics. Supply that here.
The URL of the API you would like to use.
Possible values for the URL include /metric-data --or-- /events --or-- /problems/healthrule-violations
Parameters
These are specific parameters for whatever URL you've specified above. For example, the /metric-data URL requires a metric-path parameter like metric-path=Business Transaction Performance|*|*|*|*.
The easiest way to obtain these parameters is to use the Metric Browser in AppDynamics and right click. From the pop-up menu select the Copy Full Pathoption. Wild cards are completely acceptable.
For more information and details please visit the AppDynamics Documentation.
